entry.title: Insane Deadstock Vintage T-shirt Haul
entry.content: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XjJLtS1l-qM" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>This is one for the books and by far one of the crziest deadstock digs we have ever had. We hit up an old shop that still had stock from the late 90s and early 2000s. We scored so many dope rock and horror tees and had a great time doing it.

entry.title: The Vintage Polo Archives Episode #2 - Country Jackets
entry.content: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MOXxZbkUXNA" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>Episode two is live. On this one we get into some of the interesting Polo Country Jackets. There are so many interesting mash up designs all pulling inspiration from true vintage pieces. You will see work wear, military, and hunting references throughout. Enjoy and make sure you subscribe to the youtube channel.

entry.title: The Vintage Polo Archive Video Episode #1
entry.content: <iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/mTqXXrvk8Cg" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen=""></iframe>We are finally getting our asses in gear and showing off some the Polo Collection. We have enough Polo for about 50 episodes so stay tunes and make sure you subscribe to our youtube channel. In this episode we show off some the Vintage Polo Counrty t-shirts including some indian heads, front pages, and grey mare, rolled oats and many more.

entry.title: Vintage Powell Peralta Skateboard Tshirt Collection
entry.summary: More
entry.content: I started skateboarding early in my life. I was probably only 7 or 8 years old. My dad bought me my first Dominion board, it was pink with a dragon on it. I loved it. My first proper pro board was a Powell Peralta Steve Saiz that I got from Suds Skates in St Catherines Ontario. That board along with the Tshirt and sweatshirt are in this video. I have amassed a small collection of Powell Peralta vintage tshirts over the years. Here is my collection.

entry.title: Famous Vintage Pieces from Films and TV
entry.summary: More
entry.content: I put together a list of some vintage pieces made famous from films and TV. Watch as I cover such epic pieces as the Pendleton Sweater from the Big Lebowski Film or the 8 Ball Jacket from Seinfeld. Enjoy

entry.title: Vintage Hook-Ups Skateboard Tshirt Collection
entry.summary: More
entry.content:
If you know me, you know that I collect everything skate related for vintage among many other things. Hook-ups has always stood out to me because it embodied the fuck you skateboard mentality. These T-shirts where basically banned from most schools. 

Jeremy Klein started and Hook-ups in 1993 and it's still going to this day.

I hope you like my vintage hook-ups skateboard tshirt collection.

entry.title: Massive Vintage Patagonia Fleece Collection
entry.summary: More
entry.content:
I dont really know when it began but somewhere along the way I became infatuated with Patagonia. I think it mainly started when I read "let my people go surfing" by Yvon Chouinard. There is such an amazing company culture and greatly admire what the company does for the planet. 

I have put together a video of my huge collection. I talk about some of the history of the brand, stories behind certain pieces, and talk about how to date certain Patagonia pieces. 

I show some of my rarest pieces including my Choinard rugby shirts, patagonia reverse pile fleeces, rare all weather jackets, patagonia vintage hats, retro X fleece, Rythm hooded fleece and much more. 

I hope you like it.

entry.title: FAIF @ Tommy Pier NYFW 2016
entry.summary: More
entry.content:
When it comes to doing it big, Tommy is no stranger and has been know to go all out with the brands themed fashion events. In the spirit of going above and beyond, Tommy Hilfiger will be hosting what is said to be the premier event of New York Fashion Week fall 2016 as they will be transforming South Street Seaport into "Tommy Pier".
The two day event will begin on Friday night the 9th of Sept where Tommy will be showing his collaboration with Gigi Hadid along with the Hilfiger collection. Directly following the show all items will be available for purchase but that is only half the fun. Tommy Pier, open to general public Sept 10th, will be full of you favourite nostalgic carnival attractions including a 40ft ferris wheel, mid-way games and all the junk food you could desire.
FAIF and Frankie Collective have been invited to host an all Vintage Tommy Hilfiger pop up on site. We are very honoured to be a part of this historic event showcasing some very exclusive pieces from our vast archive. Now is your chance to come out and cop some very rare and next to impossible to find vintage Tommy Hilfiger gems. 
Below is a small selection of some of the Vintage Tommy we will have up for sale. See you there!
Tommy Pier, Pier 16 South Street Seaport, New York.
Sept 9 - Sept 10 NYFW 2016.
 Shop Vintage Tommy Hilfiger

entry.title: vintage deadstock polo sport dig
entry.summary: More
entry.content:
Usually you'll find us traveling all over the world in search of digs. The grass is always greener on the other side, right? Not this time. We recently uncovered a massive deadstock Polo Sport haul right here in our hometown, Vancouver, thanks to a layup from our homie Freeky P. 
When he first told me about this spot I didnt think much of it. I figured there may be a piece or two but was definitely not expecting this amount of heat. Apparently the owners of this shop also had a second shop throughout the 90s. I sort of high end gift shop that catered to tourists and ship workers that passed through town and wanted to bring some presents home with them. They had an official Polo account at the time. When they closed up in about 98' they stashed everything away in their warehouse. 
Its safe to say that their warehouse is now void of Polo Sport as we took the whole lot and some. We came up heavy. There was lots of sick spell out Polo Sport windbreakers, golf shirts, swing top jacket plus we found some polo bear rugby shirts and bunch of other gems. We also came up on some Christian Dior bags and silk scarves as well as some sick signage. 
Watch the video -----

entry.title: Rap Tees : the book
entry.content:
One of the world's foremost collectors of all things hip-hop, DJ Ross One presents--for the first time ever--a much sought after collection of T-shirts in this lushly produced and detailed catalog showcasing over 500 of the genre's best. Rap Tees outshines all other rap tee collections and will be the definitive reference for generations to come. Providing not only a valuable reference and style guide to these ultra-rare shirts, Rap Tees is also a unique chronology of the history of hip-hop.
    
Beginning with the earliest rap concert shirts from the Sugar Hill Gang and New York Fresh Fest, circa 1980-84, and spanning the next two decades, Rap Tees includes rare shirts from a wide selection of the who's-who of the business including: Public Enemy, Boogie Down Productions, Beastie Boys, Eric B and Rakim, Wu Tang Clan, Jay Z, Nas, EMPD, and many, many more. Rap Tees bookends the golden age of rap with unique street-corner memorial shirts commemorating the deaths of The Notorious B.I.G. and Tupac Shakur.
    
Unlike typical rock n' roll shirts, hip-hop tees were often made in extremely limited quantities. The elusive concert, promotional, and bootleg tees included in this book are nearly impossible to find on the open market. Only DJ Ross One could track down these gems for you in this one-of-a-kind book, making Rap Tees the consummate guide for these unique pieces of music history.
